titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the S. I. Hayakawa papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ronald M. Bulatoff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-04T11:50-0700

change.item: Finding aid updated to note that Box 463 is closed, with access images available in Box 462.

physdesc.extent: 549 manuscript boxes, 35 cubic foot boxes, 40 card file boxes, 17 oversize boxes, 1 motion picture film reel

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, memoranda, reports, government documents, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, sound tape cassettes, videotape cassettes, and memorabilia relating to semantics and education, student radicalism, the Japanese American community, American politics, the Republican Party, and American foreign relations and domestic policy.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 463 is closed; access images are available in Box 462. Remainder of collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], S. I. Hayakawa papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1982, with increments received in later years.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings, memoranda, reports, government documents, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, sound tape cassettes, videotape cassettes, and memorabilia relating to semantics and education, student radicalism, the Japanese American community, American politics, the Republican Party, and American foreign relations and domestic policy.

did.unittitle: San Francisco State College records and correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, correspondence, institutional records, and memoranda.

did.unittitle: Proposal and notes for book written by Hayakawa regarding the student strike at San Francisco State College
Flyers, manifestos, and pamphlets denouncing Hayakawa
Clippings from and regarding The Daily Gator, San Francisco State University's student newspaper
History of San Francisco State College
Clippings and correspondence regarding an undercover police officer posing as a student
Outgoing correspondence within San Francisco State University
Magazine articles regarding Black Student Union
Memorandum and bibliographies regarding Black Student Union
Clippings regarding San Francisco State University
Peat, Marwick, Mitchell and Co., report on San Francisco State University student strike

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes DVD of two California Newsreel productions from 1969: "Black Panther" and "San Francisco State: On Strike"

did.unittitle: "The College Position on the Strike Demands"
Announcements to faculty "On the Record" newsletter
Clippings and correspondence regarding violence on universities campuses nationwide.
San Francisco State College Class Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes files from courses taught by Hayakawa.
